dialogues.text: Please, Sherry, please. Now he sits next to her, puts his arms around her and sit quietly with her. They move close to each other, they roc for a moment. Tears.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: Why did you leave? Do you love her more than Mom?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Something happened between me and Mom --

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: What -- ?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I don't know, I've got to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: You've been staying at Sandy's for a month now and you haven't figured it out?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I like it at Sandy's. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: You mean you like sleeping with her more than Mommy? She's so bony. George doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: What about what's-his-name -- Timmy?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: (a statement) You love him more.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: Is he good at cards?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Fair.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: What were you playing?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hearts.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: Did he ‘shoot the moon'?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No, I did.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: You're lying.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: He shot it twice.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: You going to take him on trips?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Remember the trip we took to Sea World -- Mommy got the speeding ticket -- ?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: And you yelled at her.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: And she told that cop off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: . SHERRY
dialogues.text: 7 Sandy wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (lovingly) Mommy's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: (agreeing pleasantly) Yeaaah. George falls silent.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: Do you hate her?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: You love her.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yes -- I guess I do --

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell her that?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: “ I can't.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: What went wrong?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I don't know. After a while, you just stop giving each other your best... Sherry watches George, he seems far away for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: . You get tired of each other, you blame each other, you never can get back what you had at first -- so you go to somebody else -- | You want a clean slate -- no black marks against you. Someone who'll make you feel all new. Sherry smiles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: So why did you sleep with Mommy at a a the motel? No answer from George. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Are you going to let Mommy get a divorce?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I think I'm going to have to.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: What happens to me?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I'll love you more --

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Because I'll have more time for you -- I'll be closer to you -- After a moment.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: I think you'll be closer to Timmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George coming into the driveway, he slows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights still on full, campers and motorcycles added L the other vehicles beside the court now, the MUSIC poin;, full blast.

dialogues.speaker: ON FAITH AND FRANK
dialogues.text: Kissing. Faith hears the CAR, she turns, sees George pul} up, Sherry gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: ON FAITH AND GEORGE AND SHERRY
dialogues.text: Faith moves away from Frank, hurries to Sherry.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: You're all right, darling -- Sherry holds up her new typewriter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: It's not an electric. Faith hesitates, smiles. She is reassured.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: It's what you wanted?

dialogues.speaker: SHERRY
dialogues.text: Sort of. Sherry sees Faith and George staring at each other, now she wanders off into the crowd. George looks over the scene.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: (to George) You don't like it?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Just the opposite.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You did it. You really did it. .

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Did what?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: The court. The tennis court. Frank approaches.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: (to George) What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What do I think about what?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: The court, what do you think? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh, the court. The court looks good. Frank beams.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: You really like it, George?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I do. It adds.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That really pleases me. I was real anxious to know how you would feel.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I like it very much.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Good. Can I get you a drink or something? We've got some real good tequila my partner brought ack from Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I'm sure. After a moment.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sure. (to George) If you change your mind, let me know. Frank wanders off into the crowd, George watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell Sherry likes her typewriter.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You're certain -~- ?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Absolutely. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Silence. Silence. 133.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Good. George looking over the gathering.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: We did the whole thing for three thousand dollars --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No kidding.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: The Bradleys paid five and theirs isn't half as good.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I've seen the Bradleys' -- you're right. you got yourself a good contractor.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Frank does careful work. You'll come over and play sometime, won't you? Bring Sandy.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: I mean -- we have to work this thing out -- be grown up about it, remember?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Sure, yeah. Be grown up about it.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Don't you want that?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: You want to meet some of Frank's friends?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Not right now. Maybe later. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: di

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Faith smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Maybe later. George smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Why don't you try the tequila -- it'll put hair on your chest. George laughs.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No, thanks. I've really got to go. Faith smiles. Pecks him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: You'll see, it'll be okay --

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Sure. George starts back for his car. Faith watches him go. Fra appears. Faith smiles, they begin to dance again. :

dialogues.speaker: ON GEORGE 130A
dialogues.text: making his way towards his car.

dialogues.speaker: TENNIS COURT 131
dialogues.text: The lights burning, the MUSIC blaring.

dialogues.speaker: ON FAITH AND FRANK
dialogues.text: Dancing slow.

dialogues.speaker: ON GEORGE'S CAR 132
dialogues.text: leaving the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE
dialogues.text: Molly, Marianne and Jill in bed, wearing tennis clothes, watching "Saturday Night Live." A sudden SCREECH.

dialogues.speaker: ON FAITH AND FRANK _ 134
dialogues.text: stop dancing. (CONTINUED)  a 135 136 137 138 135.

dialogues.speaker: ON GEORGE'S CAR 135
dialogues.text: making a wide sweeping turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing George cut through the campers and motorcycles, bo off a rock, slam into a camper, back off it, now head straight for the court.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Jee-zus.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE'S CAR
dialogues.text: Coming full speed now.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BEDROOM WINDOW 137
dialogues.text: Jill and Molly and Marianne peering out.

dialogues.speaker: ON SHERRY 138
dialogues.text: Mouth open.

dialogues.speaker: ON RICK
dialogues.text: diving underneath a camper.

dialogues.speaker: ON GEORGE
dialogues.text: hands clenching the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: ON GEORGE'S CAR
dialogues.text: Cuting through grass now, through an opening not wide enough, he smashes through the mesh surrounding the court

dialogues.speaker: A LIGHT POLE
dialogues.text: Falling.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE'S CAR
dialogues.text: Ripping right through the court, the soft surface opening up like ditches. SCREAMS .

dialogues.speaker: ON GEORGE
dialogues.text: throwing his car into another gear. Driving through anoth piece of fence. Another light pole falls. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place thrown into semi-darkness, only barbecue torche burning. Jill and Marianne and Molly sprinting down from the house towards the tennis court. Sherry running straig at George's car.

dialogues.speaker: ON GEORGE
dialogues.text: Swerving to avoid Sherry. Nothing can stop him now. He drives right through the net -- it snaps like a rubber ba George keeps driving back and forth across the court, rip it to pieces, poles and fences falling now, the summer ho topples.

dialogues.speaker: ON FRANK . 140
dialogues.text: Leaping on top of George's car. He grabs a torch. Smashes it through the windshield. The car drives blindly into th rubble of the summer house, grinds to a halt; smoke and torn metal. Frank rips open the door.

dialogues.speaker: ON FAITH . 141
dialogues.text: She screams -- runs at the car.

dialogues.speaker: ON FRANK AND GEORGE 142
dialogues.text: At each other. George -- much smaller, fighting like a maniac. Frank connects. George falls, Frank pulls him up, levels him again, Frank is merciless. Blood and hair and teeth everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE KIDS
dialogues.text: Shrieking, trying to pull Frank off -- now Faith jumps on Frank's back, he throws her off, and George is right at Frank's throat. But finally Frank raps him again. George's ear flares wit blood and. he sinks to the ground. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE COURT
dialogues.text: The guests stumned. Rick moves towards Frank. Frank ignor him, The SOUND of a motorcycle revving up. One leaves, th another. The guests drift quickly away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ON FRANK
dialogues.text: looking over at Faith. She doesn't see him. She is watchi George.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Faith. Frank waits for Faith but she doesn't move. Now Frank sta to leave, more motors start up, Frank climbs into his tru He takes one last look at Faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns now, sees Frank's truck start off down the road Trance-like, Faith takes a step towards Frank's truck as it stops once, Frank leans out the window towards her -- she still doesn't move, she is frozen -- Frank drives on. The place has emptied now.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CHILDREN 143
dialogues.text: Molly, Marianne and Jill grouped around the fallen George a crumpled heap. »

dialogues.speaker: ON SHERRY
dialogues.text: takes a wary step towards George. But Faith is there befo her.

dialogues.speaker: ON FAITH
dialogues.text: leaning over George. The children draw closer. Sherry kne down next to her father.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE'S FACE
dialogues.text: A pulp, an eye almost loose, blood running from his ear, mouth misshapen. He tries to open his lips. A tooth falls out. Faith reaches for him. She tries to lift him to his feet. He struggles with her.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I can't. George settles down now on the court. Faith scrunching do beside him. She touches her shirt against his face, tamps the blood. : (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sherry is there now, too, lying down beside George; she licks his ear,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the gore and the tears, blurred figures coming at him. The other children,

dialogues.speaker: ON GEORGE
dialogues.text: He makes a motion to Sherry and Faith, and they both lift slightly, making room for Molly; she lies down in George' lap, then Jill and Marianne come alongside. The children all find niches in George's battered

dialogues.speaker: ON GEORGE
dialogues.text: reaching out for Faith, pulling her close to him, Sherry between, all the other children fighting for room. George roans, Faith makes space for the children -- blood and lesh and sweat everywhere, they are all Packed together. One huge, human ball. -

dialogues.speaker: TENNIS COURT 144
dialogues.text: PULLING BACK now from the heap of bodies on the court, ru everywhere, stanchions fallen, the summer house splintere Another terrible groan from George. Then, silence.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Faith? =

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You there?

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I wish I could come home. George holds up his hand towards Faith. Faith reaches her hand down for George... she reaches Past George. They do not make contact. Faith takes Molly's hand, straightens u

dialogues.speaker: FAITH
dialogues.text: (gently) One of the things about growing up, George, is you stop wishing. Remember? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Faith goes with Molly. A shaft of light from a fallen lamp catches the rest of t family huddled together in the center of the court and th a long, solid, benign shadow over the woods. FADE TO BLACK.
